column4: Evening everyone.  I was wondering if someone could help me with a problum.
I got all my files locked up on my Ubuntu drive and I can't get to them
http://www.ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=154792 has the info on the issue
locked up means what exactly ?
The URL i gave you has pretty much the problum.  I can't access the partition that Ubuntu stored my /home directory n in a nutshell
didn't saw the url ... I'm looking
Thanks
so you want to recover the bootloader because windows killed it, right ?
Well that would work as well.  I plan on reinstalling Ubuntu anyway so all i need is to gain access to the partition.
did you try knoppix oder any other livecd ?
Yes, That was in the post.  I already tried using knoppix and recovering grub
what exactly did mount tell you ?
if you just want to backup your data, that should be no problem using a live cd
are you sure you got the right partition ? Did you try any other partion ? like /dev/hda1 ... /dev/hda5 or whatever
mounting ext2|3 should work out of the box in knoppix
or you could simply try to mount all ;) - shouldn't hurt
I can try that but if it's not mouting it when I try to specify it i doubt how doing a global mount will make it work\
not global: just try to mount all the different partitions and see if the working ones contain your data
otherwise I would assume your partition got corrupted ...
just try mount /dev/hdb2 /to/what/ever
I doubt they got corrupted.  I remember going through all this before trying to get a windows EXT driver to read the disk with simmiler results
did you try to mount /dev/hdb2 ?
mkay, now my insights: if you know you got the right partition and it doesn't mount, then I assume you got a problem ;)
